column4: Would someone please test this PPA for me?  I'm trying it, but it doestn' seem to find the package when I use apt-cache search or try to install it..   https://gist.github.com/b77a914daebc6d01bb16   (https://github.com/Yubico/yubico-pam)
if you are trying to install on lucid, both lucid versions in that ppa failed to build, so there is nothing to install
I am trying to use Lucid..  If i build it manually it seems to work
how did you deduce that?  How would I find that myself?
click View Package Details, under Build Status
you can't find them because they failed to build in that ppa
please run: apt-get update; first, apache2.2-bin is up to version 2.2.14-5ubuntu8.9 in lucid (it is requesting 2.2.14-5ubuntu8.6)
dohhh..  newbie move on my part
everything i have is automated w/ Chef and I forgot to pull in my apt cookbook
only a guess, maybe you don't have a shell for the in-target commands, maybe try cp instead?
good idea..  so you think it is the pipe?

yeah I think so, I notice the same issue here too: http://askubuntu.com/questions/104135/preseed-late-command-not-running though answerer seems to be able to do the redirect from ubiquity/success_command
'cp' worked great in that preseed.. thanks bud!
